metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3854 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Ceph, relating to the URL processing on RGW backends.An attacker can exploit the URL processing by providing a null URL to crashthe RGW, causing a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-base - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-common - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-fuse - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-mds - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2

ceph-mgr-rook - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2

librados2 - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2

librgw2 - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2
python3-ceph-argparse - 17.2.5-0ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '17.2.5-0ubuntu2').
